vague_description: The challenge is determining the optimal operational hours for each factory to meet production targets while managing resource constraints.
detailed_description: A drug company is making allergy pills and fever reducing pills in two factories, factory 1 and factory 2. Factory 1 produces \param{AllergyPillsFactory1} allergy pills and \param{FeverPillsFactory1} fever reducing pills per hour. Factory 2 produces \param{AllergyPillsFactory2} allergy pills and \param{FeverPillsFactory2} fever reducing pills per hour. Factory 1 is much more efficient and only requires \param{CompoundFactory1} units of a rare compound while factory 2 requires \param{CompoundFactory2} units of a rare compound. The company only has available \param{TotalCompound} units of the rare compound. If the company must make at least \param{MinAllergyPills} allergy pills and \param{MinFeverPills} fever reducing pills, how many hours should each factory be run to minimize the total time needed?
target_objective: Minimize the total operational time of the two factories
target_constraints: Available rare compound is limited to TotalCompound units
At least MinAllergyPills allergy pills must be produced
At least MinFeverPills fever reducing pills must be produced
target_parameters: Allergy pills produced per hour by factory 1
Fever reducing pills produced per hour by factory 1
Allergy pills produced per hour by factory 2
Fever reducing pills produced per hour by factory 2
Units of rare compound required by factory 1
Units of rare compound required by factory 2
Total units of the rare compound available
